LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.Title: Command Management
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.SelectCommand: Select a command to see details
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.Sort.Name: Name
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.CooldownDesc: Prevents command spamming - reminds users to be respectful
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.AliasDesc: Example: 'bp' for !backpack. Don't include '{0}' or '{1}' prefix. Can be used for translation!
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.MaxUsesPerCooldown: Max uses per command per cooldown period (0 = unlimited for this command)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.UseCommandCooldownDes:
When enabled, each command can have its own separate usage limit within the cooldown period.

This is an additional restriction on top of global event limits and karma-type caps (if those are enabled).

Disable this if you want commands to only be restricted by the global event rules.
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.MaxUsesPerCooldownDes:
The maximum number of times this specific command can be used successfully during one cooldown period.

• 0 = no per-command limit (command follows only global event cooldowns, if enabled)
• The cooldown period length is the same as the global "Event Cooldown Days" setting.

Example: If set to 3 and cooldown is 5 days, this command can be used at most 3 times in any 5-day window.
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionDescription: These settings control how risky and rewarding the !passion command is. Higher wagers usually improve chances, but critical outcomes can be very powerful — or very punishing.
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionMaxCritSuccess: Hard cap on critical success chance (%)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionCritFailReduct: Crit-fail reduction per success chance point
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionCritSuccessUpg: Chance to upgrade existing passion (vs gain new) on crit success
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionCritFailLoseCh: Chance to lose passion (vs gain useless one) on crit failure
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionTargetedCritFa: Chance targeted skill is affected (vs random other) on targeted crit failure
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionMinWagerTip: Lowest number of coins a viewer can wager on !passion (default: 10)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionMaxWagerTip: Highest number of coins allowed in a single !passion wager (default: 1000)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionWagerBonusPer1: How many % success chance is added for every 100 coins wagered (default: 1.0 = +1% per 100 coins)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionMaxWagerBonusT: Maximum bonus percentage that can come from large wagers (default: 30%)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionBaseSuccessTip: Starting success chance before any wager bonus (default: 15%)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionMaxSuccessTip: Hard upper limit on total success chance, even with big wagers (default: 60%)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionCritSuccessRat: Critical success chance = base success × this value (default: 0.2 = 20% of success chance)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionMaxCritSuccess: Absolute maximum chance for a critical success outcome (default: 5%)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionCritFailBaseTi: Starting critical failure chance before reduction (default: 10%)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionCritFailReduct: How much the crit-fail chance decreases for each % of base success (default: 0.1 = -1% crit-fail per 10% success)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionCritFailMinTip: Lowest the critical failure chance can ever go (default: 2%)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionCritSuccessUpg: Probability to upgrade an existing passion instead of adding a new one on critical success (default: 0.5 = 50%)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionCritFailLoseCh: Probability to lose an existing passion instead of gaining a useless one on critical failure (default: 0.6 = 60%)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.PassionTargetedCritFa: When using !passion [skill] — chance the targeted skill is affected on crit failure (default: 0.7 = 70%)
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.SurgeryDescription: Configure costs for special surgeries. Negative values give coins to the viewer (e.g. for donating blood via hemogen extraction).
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.SurgeryDescriptionBod: These costs apply to special cosmetic surgeries like gender swap and body type changes.
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.SurgeryToggleNote: Disabling a surgery hides it from viewers and prevents usage. Costs are shown for reference even when disabled.
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.ResetWarning:
You are about to reset all commands to defaults.

Except the Lootbox Commands coin amounts (because they are global).

This cannot be undone.
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.ResetMessage: All commands have been reset to defaults.
LanguageData.CAP.CommandManager.ResetError: An error occurred while resetting commands: {0}
